page.title: 17Fairhurst Hall Parbold
page.content: Fairhurst Hall stands in its own grounds to the east of the River Douglas.It was originally built of timber frames in the 18th century, but has been adapted several times. The barn at the bottom of the drive is converted into a house with a separate owner.Where the lawns stretch out and upwards at the front of the house-it was once dense forest,only a few enormous beech trees remain at the side.The kitchen and cook's quarters were where the back yard now is.The house is hidden from public view but on the road side by the entrance gates is the lodge to Fairhurst Hall.
